Description: Limestone canopic jar with flat base and flaring sides, drawn in at shoulder, with remains of four vertical registers of black-painted hieroglyphs on front; the cover is ape-headed, representing Hapy, with details of eyes and eye-brows painted black.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1993-2003, Newcastle, The Hancock Museum, Land of the Pharaohs 2006/8 Sept-Sept, Wallsend, Segedunum Roman Fort & Baths Museum, Egypt Revealed
